In my book, a beautiful unit test is one that tests as much as possible,
as=
 simply as possible.  I don't usually associate "clever" with "keep is
simp=
le stupid" but maybe that's just me.  I think a beautiful JUnit test
would =
be one that uses both inheritance and the "parameterized test
case" pattern=
 to be as short and sweet (and therefore maintainable) as
possible.  But th=
at just this beholder's eye.


Todd.
